trans-unit.source: Represents a user or user-group for granting access to rights managed content.
As with other <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement> types, <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser> is only usable in full trust applications.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> class.
The user or group `name` is often in the form of an individual e-mail address (such as johndoe@contoso.com) or an e-mail distribution list (such as marketing@contoso.com).
The user or group name.
The method for authentication.
Gets an instance of the "Anyone" <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> persona.

<xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AnyoneUser%2A> has <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AuthenticationType%2A> "Internal" and <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.Name%2A> "Anyone".

If <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AuthenticationType%2A> "Internal" with <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.Name%2A> "Anyone" is granted rights during publishing, the authentication server will issue a <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.UseLicense> to any request and will attach the license to the requesting user.
An instance of the "Anyone" <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> persona.

Gets the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType"></xref> specified to the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.#ctor(System.String,System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType)"></xref> constructor.

The <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType"></xref> specified to the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.#ctor(System.String,System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType)"></xref> constructor.
Returns a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> is equivalent to another given instance.
The user instance to compare for equality.

`true` if <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.Name"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AuthenticationType"></xref> are the same for both this user and the given user; otherwise, `false`.

Returns a computed hash code based on the user <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.Name"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AuthenticationType"></xref>.
A hash code computed from the user <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.Name"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AuthenticationType"></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the user is currently authenticated.
The given user <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.Name%2A> is authenticated based on the given <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AuthenticationType%2A>.

After a user has been authenticated and <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.IsAuthenticated%2A> is `true`, the user dialog and prompt to confirm authentication is no longer displayed when creating a <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.SecureEnvironment>.
`true` if the user is currently authenticated; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false` until authenticated.
Gets the user or group name specified to the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.#ctor(System.String,System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType)"></xref> constructor.
The user or group name specified to the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.#ctor(System.String,System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType)"></xref> constructor.
Gets an instance of the "Owner" <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> persona.

<xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.OwnerUser%2A> has <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.AuthenticationType%2A> "Internal" and <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.Name%2A> "Owner".
<xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser.OwnerUser%2A> is used by the server-side templates to give special rights to the content author or publisher when the protected document is created.
An instance of the "Owner" <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> persona.
